posts.message:
Create Matrix Like screen using Ruby

the idea is that this screen is a vertical lines each line
moves vertically in random speed.

each line has number of entities, each entity has a random 
character with random size.

each character is will be changed randomly, 
so we created an entity class with this features 
then created the vertical lines of them has the same number 
of characters but with different speeds.

and let them roll..
after creating it i noticed that it changed to new character
by 60 change per second (the FPS) so i had to invent a small technique
to skip some second for the character changing.

i could have been changed the FPS to lower value but this will slow
down the lines movement, so to keep lines moving smoothly i kept FPS 
high anad skipped random number of frames using a entity class member
update_limit and last_update

Gist: https://gist.github.com/9584057
ما فيش كورس فيديو فى الsql

posts.message:
حفلة الأسبوع 
----------
المسألة المرة دى : http://projecteuler.net/problem=38
هى بتتكلم عن مفهوم جديد فى نظرية الأعداد و هى الأعداد الpandigital 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pandigital_number
و دى اعداد ليها خاصية مميزة وهى ان الأرقام اللى بيتكون منها السيستيم المفروض تكون موجودة على الأقل مرة واحدة فى العدد.
ركز فى المسألة، السحلب جنبك، الكومبيلر معاك، وورينا الأكواد العظيمة
سورى على التأخير، رحت اخطب و جيت :D

posts.message:
Create a Waving ColorSpace using ruby

this screen consist of equal squares, each one has a color
in the format (Hue, Saturation, Value), and a color velocity+direction
each time we want to wave the color, we'll add the color velocity
to the color components respectively, and if the color reached 
the component limit e.g(0<Hue<360) the Color will reset to the limit.
that was easy, script is flexible so you can enlarge screen dimension
to get a bigger dream :), and you can play with squares numeber for higher
resolution or lower one.

Have fun playing with it, also if you have any great idea for tomorrow's script
send me a message, or put it in a comment here.

Gist: https://gist.github.com/9598606
